page.title: 19RELIGION
page.content: St.Andrew's church was built in the 14th century by the Bourchier family who lived at Stansted Hall. The{Bell {Tower}was built in 1848. There are 41 steps up and it is very steep. All the bells have names written on them in Latin. In the tower there is a ringers jar, which the people who rang the bells had, and they would go to people and ask for a drink. They would get a mixture of drinks. There is a verse to go with it."If you be wise-fill me not twice-at one sitting." In the tower there have been a lot of accidents. Only 12 people can ring at once as there are only 8 bells. The last time the bell tower was cleaned was in 1957. The tower also houses the town clock and this is wound up every other day. It chimes every quarter of an hour. On Sundays 70 people go to the services. There are 24 choir members.
